description: The Russian Army is facing difficulties in local battles due to well-prepared enemy defenses, including modern FPV drones of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Despite having the initiative, the Russian Army is struggling to make progress.
original:
04/09/24. A note from the channel “Two Majors”.
“Such monsters based on Russian tanks are equipped with protection of all stripes and types, because drones pose a serious threat to our armored vehicles.
Show more
Enemy channels are replete with maps of defeat of our armored fighting vehicles in almost all sectors of the front where we are conducting an offensive.
If there is electronic warfare, and suddenly the frequencies that it jams coincide, then it is most often used unsystematically.
At the moment, in local battles, although it had the initiative, the Russian Army ran into well-prepared enemy defenses.
Prepared not even in terms of fortification, but in terms of modern weapons in the form of FPV drones of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
Promotion is very difficult. The enemy is competently conducting a defensive operation. At the same time, he conducts an informational campaign: he lulls him to sleep with his screams that everything is lost.
Things really aren't going well for the Ukrainian Armed Forces. But it’s impossible to say that his defense is bursting at the seams.
Previously, we made assumptions that our troops would be stretched not only along the front, but also in depth.”

A rally against NATO took place in Naples: the police brutally dispersed the protesters with batons.
Eight people were injured, three with head and facial injuries, ANSA reported.
Show more

description: The Baltic Fleet will conduct control checks over several weeks, where ship crews will practice course tasks at sea ranges, including firing at sea, air, and coastal targets. Military personnel will also pass standards for fire and special training, and conduct exercises using weapons and military equipment. Naval aviation flight personnel will demonstrate their preparedness and ability to perform missions with practical use of aviation weapons.
original:
During the control checks, which will take place in the Baltic Fleet over several weeks, the crews of the fleet's ships will practice various elements of course tasks at sea ranges, conduct preparatory and test exercises, during which they will fire at sea, air and coastal targets.

During the control checks, military personnel will pass standards for fire and special training, and will conduct various training and exercises using weapons and military equipment.

Naval aviation flight personnel will demonstrate their individual preparedness and ability to perform missions as intended with the practical use of aviation weapons.

description: Belarus banned the sale of all products from Russian company Orimi, including Greenfield, Tess, Princess Nuri, Princess Java, Pearl of the Nile, Gita, Shah, Princess Kandy teas, as well as Jardin and Jockey. The Ministry of Health claimed that four types of bagged tea produced in Russia contained excess mold content.
original:
In Belarus, they banned the sale of all products of the Russian company Orimi, which produces Greenfield, Tess, Princess Nuri, Princess Java, Pearl of the Nile, Gita, Shah, Princess Kandy teas, as well as Jardin and "Jockey".

The day before, the Ministry of Health of Belarus announced a ban on the sale in the country of four types of bagged tea produced in Russia. The trademarks in question were “Geeta” and “Princess Kandy”. The agency claims that their products contained excess mold content.

Orimi called such a ban excessive and clarified that the violations could have been the result of non-compliance with transportation or storage conditions.@kommersant

original: Deutsche Welle tells what we wrote about a year ago: there are practically no men left in the villages - the limit has been exhausted. Meanwhile, the villagers were an important and reliable source of mobilization. Men from the village were more willing to join the army due to the low standard of living and relatively high salaries in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Now the villages are empty and the cemeteries are overcrowded@OpenUkraine

description: A group of scammers, posing as a former Russian Guard member and a representative of 3mx company, attempted to sell a DJI Mavic 3T quadcopter to unsuspecting buyers. After transferring 460,000 rubles, the seller tried to flee, but was detained and handed over to the police. An application was submitted to the 76th police department.
location: Gallery shopping center, St. Petersburg, Russia
original:
Our friends, who regularly help the squad when purchasing a drone to send to the squad, came across scammers, or rather an organized criminal group operating in the central region of St. Petersburg.

They found an ad on Avito for the sale of a DJI Mavic 3T quadcopter. After a short correspondence with the seller, we called and arranged a meeting to check the functionality of the device.

We met at the Gallery shopping center, the copter was working, it even had the necessary firmware. From the seller came Vladislav Averba, who alternately showed the identity of a former Russian Guard member, then referred to the 3mx company, or showed a video with his participation on the Russia 24 channel.

After transferring 460,000 rubles, the seller waited until the money was withdrawn by his accomplices, and then tried to leave with the phrase “Do you think we are scammers?” Of course, they thought so; the seller was detained on his own and handed over to the police. We submitted an application to the 76th police department (KUSP 8819 dated 04/03/2024).

Now everything is fine with them, they are free, they refuse to negotiate with our lawyer, they claim that they are having “field tests”, they adhere to their legend, despite the fact that we contacted the real 3mx and naturally no one knows about such people.

A natural question arises: is this really an isolated incident? The seller was very surprised that he was not allowed to joyfully spend the stolen money, which means other times it was different. How is it that under so many cameras in the very center of the city, none of the responsible officials notice them? Or do they notice?

Zelensky visited Kharkov, where the situation with electricity is difficult, and ordered to improve consumer disconnection schedules.

“We reported on the physical protection of energy facilities, the restoration of networks, now all the necessary conditions are being created to reduce the shortage of electricity. Kharkov should receive easy schedules, officials are working separately to help the city and region to overcome existing energy challenges,” the president said and promised to allocate funds for this is the direction.

He believes that the goal of the Russian Federation is to “displace people from Kharkov, from the region.”

We discussed strengthening air defense and building fortifications in the region. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Poland Requests Nuclear Weapons from US
description: Polish President Andrzej Duda has requested the placement of nuclear warheads on Polish territory as part of the NATO Nuclear Sharing program. This is not the first time Poland has made such a request, with the US previously denying it due to Poland's entry into NATO after 1997.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇵🇱🇺🇸The Polish government is again asking the Americans for nuclear weapons.

Polish President Andrzej Duda said that it was extremely advisable to achieve the placement of nuclear warheads on the territory of the republic within the framework of the NATO Nuclear Sharing program. At the same time, he prudently added that, in principle, “he does not see the possibility of starting a nuclear war,” it’s just that now, so to speak, is a good moment.📌Nuclear Sharing is a program of NATO member states for the deployment and storage of the American nuclear arsenal in Europe. It provides that the governments of these countries can also participate in planning and exercises related to this type of weapon. The desire of the Poles to become part of the nuclear program and the constant refusals of the Americans are as stable as the ebb and flow of the tides. Conversations about this come up on average once every few months and it is quite logical that they were started again.

The last time the Polish authorities received a rather sharp answer from Washington, the arguments of which cannot be argued with. The State Department indicated that the United States does not intend to deploy nuclear weapons in Poland and other countries that joined NATO after 1997. On what basis they did not specify, but Poland entered the alliance in 1999 along with Hungary and the Czech Republic, and the mincemeat is not turning back. It is quite obvious that the Poles continue to try to beg for bargains before getting bogged down as “cannon fodder” in the all-too-calm Western Ukraine. Considering that the Belarusians have nuclear Iskanders on the same border, it is logical that Warsaw also wants to have at least some argument before the suicide mission.#USA#Poland@rybartogether with @pl_syrenkaSupport uswww.gazetaprawna.plSpecjalnie dla DGP. Duda: Jakim prawem Bodnar chce kogoś weryfikować czy też kwe...- Ustawa o KRS nie zyska mojej akceptacji w tej postaci, ponieważ nie ma podstaw do różnicowania sędziów. Sędziowie otrzymali nominację od prezydenta ...

description: Russian artillery units in the Northern Military District zone employ camouflage, temporary positions, and reloading tactics to evade enemy detection. Fighters occupy temporary positions during attacks, then quickly relocate to avoid being targeted. The enemy's use of FVP drones has increased, suggesting they have suffered significant equipment losses.
original:
Camouflage, temporary positions and reloading - the work of Russian artillery in the Northern Military District zone was shown by Izvestia correspondent Leonid Kitrar.

Now the enemy is working less on the ground, FVP drones are being used more, noted a fighter with the call sign “Baikal.” “It looks like they have a lot of destroyed equipment, they have nothing to work with,” the serviceman suggested. During an attack, our fighters occupy so-called temporary positions. After the shooting is completed, the car drives into a small forest just to wait and be sure that it is not being followed. After a certain time, the car leaves for the main position, the Izvestia journalist said. “It is very important to leave quickly. Because if we hit some targets, then most likely they will figure us out and begin to work on us. And our task leave as quickly as possible,” said a serviceman with the call sign “Hurricane.” Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Russia is employing a double strike tactic to capture Chasov Yar, involving a pincer movement from the north and south, accompanied by a direct frontal assault from the east. This tactic has been successfully used in previous battles, such as Avdeevka, Bakhmut, and Novomikhailovka.
original: Russia is advancing on Chasov Yar with a double strike tactic, - BILD analyst This conclusion was reached by BILD open data analysis expert Julian Röpke, who studied the maneuvers of the Russian Armed Forces near Chasov Yar over the past 10 days (on the map). According to him, Russia has previously used double push tactics when capturing Ukrainian cities and villages. It consists of bypassing enemy positions from the flanks and at the same time a direct frontal attack. “In the battle for Chasov Yar, the Russian invasion forces are trying to implement their successful (Avdeevka, Bakhmut, Novomikhailovka, etc.) “double strike” tactics: pincers from the north and south plus a direct assault on the city from the east,” writes Röpke.

description: Briton Russell Cook completed a 16,000 km run across Africa in 352 days, raising £700,000 for charity. He faced numerous challenges, including theft, health issues, and visa problems, but pushed through to achieve his goal.
original:
Forwarded from: Varlamov News
Briton Russell Cook ran across Africa, covering more than 16 thousand kilometers in 352 days; he raised £700,000 for charity during the race - BBC, Sky News

The 27-year-old athlete ran from the southernmost point of Africa to the northernmost point through 16 countries. In Angola, Cook and members of his team had money, passports and equipment stolen; in Nigeria, the runner had to stop for examination due to poor health; in the Republic of Congo, Cook was held for several days by local residents armed with machetes; and for some time he could not get to Algeria from - for lack of a visa.

According to the Briton, he suffers from psychological problems, including addiction to gambling and alcohol, and with this marathon he wanted to “change the situation.”

Cook claims to be the first in the world to run across the whole of Africa, but the World Running Association, which has only seven members, says Dane Jesper Olsen became the first back in 2010, although he crossed only eight countries and covered 12.8 kilometers - The Telegraph

description: Leonid Pasechnik held a meeting with municipal leaders and representatives of the Administration of the Head of the Lugansk People's Republic. He emphasized the importance of integrating the region into Russia's national mechanism, ensuring harmonious local cooperation, and fulfilling tasks assigned by President Putin.
original:
Forwarded from: Leonid Pasechnik
Held a working meeting with the heads of municipalities in the region and representatives of the Administration of the Head of the Lugansk People's Republic.

I noted an important point: despite the transition period that continues in the Lugansk People's Republic, the work requirements are the same as in other regions of Russia. Since we are a full-fledged subject of the Russian Federation, we need to integrate as quickly and fully as possible into all spheres of the country’s life.

I focused the attention of municipal leaders on the need to work harmoniously and together locally. We must dynamically and clearly integrate into the work of the national mechanism. This is the only way we will be able to effectively carry out any tasks, including those assigned to us by President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin.

He admits that the Armed Forces began to fight much more cautiously and began to learn from mistakes. At the same time, the Russian command is simply throwing manpower at the assault on the positions of the Armed Forces, during which most of the Russian soldiers die.

After Avdiivka, videos of "meat assaults" with massive destruction of Russian armored vehicles along the entire front flooded Telegram channels and social networks. Every captured kilometer is given to the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation at a huge price.

event: Gabe Newell's Interview on Brain-Computer Interfaces
description: In a 2021 interview with 1News, Gabe Newell, co-founder of Valve, discussed the potential of brain-computer interfaces. He highlighted their capabilities to induce sensations, alter mood, and enhance concentration. Newell also mentioned the risks of obsolescence and vulnerability to malware.
original:
Forwarded from: CYBERBOREA
Now the news has begun to spread that Gabe Newell, the famous head of Valve, lost weight and became a co-founder of the company developing brain-computer interfaces Starfish. The news, in fact, is not new - back in 2021, Newell gave an interview to the New Zealand channel 1News and told amazing things, pure cyberpunk: Neurocomputer interfaces are capable of directly causing sensations and experiences in the brain, without the need for processing by the senses. With their help, it is possible to change mood. It will be possible to increase concentration and motivation on command. Sleep will turn into a launchable application with set parameters - how much time and phases of sleep the user wants to experience. The pace of research work in this area is such that the product risks becoming obsolete the moment it enters the market. Brain computer interfaces will be as common as smartphones today. The human brain is very flexible and can learn to control new tools as part of its body. It is possible to control new limbs, for example, robotic tentacles. Brain computer interfaces are vulnerable to malware, like other computer systems.

description: Yaroslavl airport 'Tunoshna' reported a 56.5% decrease in net profit in 2023, amounting to 20.788 million rubles. Despite a 10% increase in revenue, the airport's gross loss increased by 5.3% due to rising costs.
original:
Yaroslavl airport "Tunoshna" in 2023 reduced net profit by 56.5% JSC "Yaroslavl airport "Tunoshna" in 2023 received 20.788 million rubles of net profit, which is 56.5% less than a year earlier. Airport revenue increased by 10% - to 95.762 million rubles, the cost of sales increased by 8.5% - to 140.338 million rubles, the gross loss increased by 5.3% - to 44.576 million rubles, Interfax reports with reference to data from the company's report.

“Other income” of the joint-stock company last year decreased by 21.3% - to 91.9 million rubles, “other expenses” doubled, amounting to 19.3 million rubles. As a result, profit before tax decreased by 55% - to 27.3 million rubles.

The JSC's accounts payable decreased by 15.5% over the year, to 30.8 million rubles, while accounts receivable increased 9.2 times, amounting to 44 million rubles. The company's net assets in 2023 reached 117 million rubles (an increase of 21.6%).aviastat.ru/n269906

description: A resident of the Vologda region, Antonina Smolina, was denounced due to a photo of her wearing a yellow jacket against a blue sky, which allegedly evoked associations with enemy symbols. A policeman visited her, and she had to write an explanation, stating that she couldn't afford to change jackets based on public opinion.
original:
A resident of the Vologda region was denounced because of a photo in a yellow jacket against a blue sky.

According to Antonida Smolina, on April 3 a policeman visited her. He explained that a man wrote a statement against her - he did not like the photo of Smolina in a yellow down jacket against the sky. They say that the picture evokes associations with enemy symbols.

The woman had to write an explanation. In it, she indicated that the color of the sky does not depend on her, and due to her salary, she cannot afford to change down jackets every time the public assessment of a particular color changes. As Smolina told BAZ, the policeman treated the situation with understanding and said that she could write whatever she thought.

Antonina found an informer on social networks. It turned out to be a certain Valery Nikolaevich. In her explanation, she wished him success, health, well-being and to find a socially useful hobby that is not associated with prolonged use of gadgets, because this negatively affects human health. “I decided to talk about this so that people understand that they need to be careful - there are no guarantees that there are normal people next to you.”

description: The State Transport Leasing Company (STLC) received 2.5 billion rubles in budget funds to implement a preferential leasing program for drones in 2024, as part of the national project 'Unmanned Aircraft Systems'. The program aims to provide equal access to government support measures for UAS operators, offering a preferential rate of 3.5% to 8.5% and a leasing term of 3 to 5 years.
original:
STLC opens a program for preferential leasing of drones, having received budget funds. The State Transport Leasing Company (STLC) received 2.5 billion rubles. budget funds for the implementation of the preferential leasing program for drones in 2024 within the framework of the national project “Unmanned Aircraft Systems” (UAS).

The funds were provided by STLC in the form of a contribution to the authorized capital. The total volume of the program for 2024, taking into account extrabudgetary funds, is 3.1 billion rubles.

STLC is the basic executor of the program. Within this framework, a preferential rate will be applied from 3.5% to 8.5%, depending on the key rate. The leasing term for drones is from 3 to 5 years.

“The program is designed in such a way as to ensure equal access for UAS operators to government support measures in the form of preferential leasing,” said the head of the State Transport Leasing Company Evgeniy Dietrich. Subscribe to @ATOjournal

Cameron’s desire to meet with Trump is quite natural, given that London remains the most active supporter of continued military support for Ukraine, political scientist Alexander Asafov noted in a commentary for Paragraph: “In this regard, Trump plays a fairly serious role, he has influence on congressmen. Moreover, his position is being realized one way or another, since Zelensky already agrees to take money on credit, and not just as gratuitous assistance. description: A 28-year-old man from Vovchanski Khutory village will be tried in absentia for collaborative activity during the capture of Vovchansk city. He assumed the role of 'police commissioner' in an illegal law enforcement agency, conducting illegal searches and drawing up documents according to Russian legislation. He received wages in Russian rubles and is currently hiding in the Russian Federation.
original:
🔷The man who became a "participant" during the capture of the city of Vovchansk will be tried 🖌️The Chuguyiv district prosecutor's office of the Kharkiv region approved and sent to court an indictment against a 28-year-old man for collaborative activity (Part 7 of Article 111-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

The accused is a resident of the village. Vovchanski Khutory.

He moved for a "better life" to the then-occupied city of Vovchansk.

According to the investigation, there the collaborator assumed the position of "police commissioner" in the illegal law enforcement agency "Volchanskiy district internal department of the Department of the Internal Police of the Volchansky District of the Kharkiv Region".

The pseudo-law enforcement officer conducted illegal searches of people and drew up procedural documents in accordance with Russian legislation.
 
For working for the enemy, he received wages in Russian rubles.

Currently, the collaborator is hiding from Ukrainian justice on the territory of the Russian Federation, he is wanted.

The accused will be tried in absentia in the Chuguyiv city court of the Kharkiv region.

The sanction of the article provides for deprivation of liberty for a period of twelve to fifteen years with deprivation of the right to hold certain positions or to engage in certain activities for a period of ten to fifteen years and with or without confiscation of property.

The pre-trial investigation was carried out by the Chief of Police Department No. 1 of the Chuguyiv District Police Department of the GUNP in the Kharkiv Region. ⚔️Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: The Russian missile ship 'Serpukhov' was damaged and remains afloat, but its modern technological equipment is out of order and requires a long time to repair. Ukraine's Main Intelligence Directorate considers this a significant loss for the Black Sea Fleet.
original:
The Russian Federation wanted to transfer the disabled missile ship “Serpukhov” to the Black Sea - Yusov “Given the losses of the Black Sea Fleet, such compensation scenarios are being considered by the enemy,” noted Andrey Yusov, a representative of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine.

Yusov added: the fact that the ship burned out means that the ship remains afloat, but modern technological equipment is out of order, damaged, and it takes a long time to repair the ship.

“It has power. Because this is the direction where Russia is forced to constantly threaten NATO. But the transfer of ships is quite complicated. It is clear that Türkiye does not allow warships to pass through. Other logistics routes exist, but they are complex and long. In any case, the expansion of the actual theater of operations for the Russian fleets is good news,” says Yusov.

There are no safe places for military installations on Russian territory, the GUR representative added. Telegram Crimean Wind By the way, the Serpukhov missile launcher, which burned out today in Baltiysk, was originally part of the Russian Black Sea Fleet

description: On April 10, 1944, the 3rd Ukrainian Front, led by Army General Rodion Malinovsky, liberated Odessa from Nazi invaders with the help of partisans and underground fighters. The operation aimed to defeat the enemy group between the Southern Bug and Dniester rivers, liberate the northwestern coast of the Black Sea and Odessa, and reach the border with Romania.
original:
April 10, 1944 80 years ago Odessa was liberated from the Nazi invaders.
On April 10, 1944, with the active participation of partisans and underground fighters, the troops of the 3rd Ukrainian Front under the command of Army General Rodion Malinovsky were liberated from the Nazi
Show more
invaders of Odessa. The liberation of the city was part of an offensive operation carried out by troops of the 3rd Ukrainian Front with the assistance of the Black Sea Fleet from March 26 to April 14, 1944.
The goal of the operation was to defeat the enemy group between the Southern Bug and Dniester rivers, liberate the northwestern coast of the Black Sea and Odessa and reach the border with Romania. The battle for the city lasted for two days. On April 10, the Soviet flag was raised over the building of the Opera and Ballet Theater. The restoration of the city began almost immediately: during the occupation, many plants and factories were destroyed in Odessa, more than 2 thousand buildings were blown up and burned, the seaport, hospitals, clinics and sanatoriums were destroyed.
27 formations of the 3rd Ukrainian Front were awarded the honorary names “Odessa”. In total, about 60 formations and units distinguished themselves. 13,000 soldiers who took part in the liberation of the city were awarded orders and medals of the Soviet Union. 15 defenders of Odessa received the title of Hero of the Soviet Union.

description: Nobel Prize-winning physicist Peter Higgs, who predicted the existence of the Higgs boson, has passed away at the age of 94 after a short illness. He died peacefully at home on April 8.
original:
Nobel Prize winner in physics Peter Higgs has died at the age of 94, the University of Edinburgh, where the professor worked, said on Monday.

“It has been announced that Professor Peter Higgs has passed away at the age of 94. He passed away peacefully at home on Monday, April 8, after a short illness,” reads a statement published on the university’s website.

Higgs predicted the existence of one of the elementary particles, the boson, 48 years before his discovery, which was eventually named after him.

Now, for example, differences between Israeli and Danish army information systems (for example, in the field of targeting and communications) will have to be resolved. Also, no one took into account the costs of ammunition and personnel in the contract.

As a result, the value of the contracts amounted to $252 million. And additional costs could exceed 100 million euros, while ATMOS 2000 and PULS will be delivered to the Danish army only in 2026 at best.@NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

description: Russian scientists from the Institute of Solar-Terrestrial Physics SB RAS collaborated with colleagues in Mexico to monitor the solar eclipse. Led by astronomer Stanislav Korotky, the team of 40 'eclipse hunters' successfully captured high-quality images of the solar corona from the Mexican mountains despite strong winds.
original: Irkutsk scientists monitored the progress of the solar eclipse with the help of colleagues in Mexico. Scientists from the Institute of Solar-Terrestrial Physics SB RAS@ID_SB_RAS monitored the progress of the solar eclipse thanks to colleagues who went to observe it in Mexico. About 40 “eclipse hunters” worked overseas under the leadership of the famous Russian astronomer Stanislav Korotky.📷The team successfully filmed in the Mexican mountains at an altitude of 2400 m. Despite strong winds, Russian astrophotographers received numerous high-quality images of the solar corona.☀️It was one of the most long eclipses in this century - the maximum duration of the total phase was 4 minutes 28 seconds. The shadow of the Moon ran across the territory of Mexico, the USA, Canada and across the ocean, says the ISTP SB RAS report.🔗For more details, visit the RAS website.

description: A local resident in the Zaporozhye region staged a pogrom in a cemetery, destroying 31 tombstones due to personal problems. The police quickly responded to the incident, detaining the 43-year-old suspect and opening a criminal case under Article 244 of the Russian Federation's Criminal Code.
original:
In the Zaporozhye region, police quickly found a local resident who staged a pogrom in a cemetery

This is exactly the picture the residents of the urban village of Mikhailovka saw when they came to the cemetery. A terrifying picture appeared before their eyes - torn out crosses, fallen tombstones, broken granite and rolled up tombstone reinforcement.

People were outraged by the act of vandalism, and immediately reported it to the Mikhailovsky police department of the Vasilievsky Department of Internal Affairs of Russia.

This incident caused quite a stir among the local population; the police directed all their efforts to search for the attacker. As a result of a complex of operational-search activities, criminal investigation officers found and detained the suspect as soon as possible.

As it turned out, the pogrom at the churchyard was perpetrated by a 43-year-old man of no fixed abode. The detainee told the police that he destroyed 31 tombstones due to personal problems.

At the moment, police officers are checking the detainee for involvement in committing other crimes in the Zaporozhye region and in other constituent entities of the Russian Federation.

Now, based on this fact, the investigation unit has opened a criminal case under Part 1 of Article 244 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “desecration of the bodies of the dead and their burial places.” The suspect was interrogated, confessed and a preventive measure was chosen.

description: The Arbitration Court of the Astrakhan Region ruled in favor of Singam, a waste collection company, declaring Rosprirodnadzor's refusal to register the landfill in Volgograd's Sovetsky district illegal. The court found that the refusal violated the company's rights, as operating a landfill without registration is illegal.
original:
Forwarded from: Sapa South
The ex-deputy's company won a lawsuit against Rosprirodnadzor over the scandalous landfill in Volgograd. The court declared illegal the refusal of Rosprirodnadzor for the Astrakhan and Volgograd regions to include the landfill in the Sovetsky district of Volgograd in the state register of waste disposal facilities. The claim was filed by the tenant of the Singam landfill. The case was considered by the Arbitration Court of the Astrakhan Region.

The agency refused to register the landfill in October 2023. Experts were confused by the type of waste that was planned to be disposed of at the landfill, the start date of its operation (1996, although 2001 was mentioned in the courts) and the fact that the company stored waste on the territory of a former sand quarry.

As part of the consideration of the case, they presented a conclusion on the landfill project from 1996, a sanitary and epidemiological report from the regional Rospotrebnadzor and other documents. As a result, the court decided that the refusal to register violated the company’s rights, since the use of a landfill without being included in the register is illegal. Singam is engaged in waste collection, 51% of the company’s authorized capital belongs to ex-deputy of the Volgograd City Duma Fedor Litvinenko. Now he is suspected of fraud with insurance payments. Singam worked in 2023 with a profit of 5.7 million rubles with revenue of 18 million. In May 2022, the company was fined 300 thousand for dumping waste in a landfill that was not included in the state register. Then Rosprirodnadzor stated that this place “does not have design features characteristic of a waste disposal facility.” A year later, the company was fined again, adding that the landfill could not be registered with the state due to the “lack of a waste disposal facility that meets the requirements.” Subscribe to Sapa Yug|Give us your vote

Forwarded from: Office of the Prosecutor General
Yuriy Belousov: It is known about 54 Ukrainian prisoners of war executed by the Russian military 🔷The Office of the Prosecutor General has 27 criminal proceedings on the facts of the execution of Ukrainian prisoners of war. It is about the murder of 54 defenders. This was stated on the air of "Suspilny" by Yury Belousov, the head of the Department for Combating Crimes Committed in the Armed Conflict. Commenting on the video published on social networks on April 7, the head of the Department noted that it was previously confirmed: the crime took place near Krynok in the Kherson region, but the details are still being checked. Yuriy Belousov urged to remember the loved ones and not to announce the names of the dead prematurely. 💬According to this fact and the previous ones, we also work out the command, which is responsible for such actions. It is not only about unit commanders, but also about the highest military and political leadership. Because this is not an isolated case, but evidence of Russian policy. 🔹Cases of executions of Ukrainian prisoners of war have been recorded since March 2022. The court has already sentenced the first Russian soldier for the execution of a defender in Chernihiv region. The investigation is complicated by the fact that prosecutors and investigators usually do not have access to the crime scene or the opportunity to examine the body. 💬But this work is ongoing. Ukraine has a unique experience of documenting crimes without even having access to the territory... We work with the International Criminal Court, the UN Monitoring Mission, intelligence agencies and non-governmental organizations that also collect information. Our task now is to document, record, tell the world the truth. It's only a matter of time before the criminals end up on the dock.

event: JPMorgan Chase CEO's Letter to Shareholders
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon's letter to shareholders highlights the challenges faced by America's global leadership, emphasizing the need for partnership with Western countries to promote democracy. He also acknowledges China's growing power and potential threat, citing three key areas where the US has underestimated China: over-reliance on China for supply chains, national security concerns, and unfair competition in critical industries.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
Americans know how to present beautifully. A purely American view of world problems, worth reading to understand why they are so proud and arrogant. We lack this psychological understanding of American perception. We love to present ourselves as the smartest and the rest as fools. This is our colossal mistake. Americans don’t read Simonyan, but these stubborn Daimons, who will give a hundred points ahead to all our propaganda. There is a lot of interesting information not only about China, read in full. In fact, in Russia there is no normal American studies, no normal sinology, no effective propaganda. James Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan, admitted that the Americans slept through China (from a letter to shareholders) Around the world, 2023 has become another year of serious challenges. Almost all countries felt the effects of global economic uncertainty last year.

America's global leadership is being challenged by other countries and within our polarized electorate. We need to find ways to put aside our differences and work in partnership with other Western countries for the sake of democracy.UNITING THE WESTERN WORLD IS A UNIQUE AMERICAN CHALLENGEOnly America has all the capabilities of military power, economic power and the principles that most people around the world strive for - based on freedom and justice for all and the proposition that all men are created equal. There is no alternative to American leadership. The only potential superpower is China. It is justified that the Western world has significantly underestimated China's growing power and potential threat. It is also true that China has focused comprehensively and strategically on these economic issues while we have been sleeping.

We missed a potential threat from three points of view. The first is the over-reliance of companies on China as the only link in their supply chain.

But to the extent that it concerns everyday items such as clothing, sneakers and consumer products, this relationship is not as critical and will eventually be eliminated.

The second is the most critical. The United States cannot rely on any potential adversaries for matters affecting our national security—think rare earths, 5G and semiconductors, penicillin, and materials needed to make essential pharmaceuticals, among others.

We also cannot share vital technologies that could enhance an adversary's military capabilities.

The third challenge is also difficult: combating unfair competition or “mercantilist” behavior in critical industries; think about electric vehicles, renewable energy and artificial intelligence, among other things.

All of these problems can be solved, although they will take time and dedicated effort. We must be tough, but we must engage with China. Over the past 20 years, China has implemented a more comprehensive economic strategy than we have. The country's leaders have successfully grown their nation and have the first or second largest economy in the world.

Although China has become the largest trading partner of many countries in the world, its own GDP per capita is $13,000. The country still faces many economic and internal problems.

China has its own national security problems.

The country is located in a very politically sensitive part of the world, and many of China's actions have caused its neighbors (such as Japan, Korea, the Philippines, and others) to begin rearming and essentially moving closer to the United States.

It is clear that China's new leadership has taken a different course, paying much more attention to national security, military capabilities and domestic development. It's their right and we just need to adapt to it.

While we may always have a difficult relationship with China, the country's sheer size and importance to many other countries requires us to continue to engage—thoughtfully and without fear.The China ThreatJPMorgan Chase & Co.Letter to Shareholders from Jamie Dimon, Annual Report 2023 | JPMorgan Chase & Co.Letter to Shareholders from Jamie Dimon, Annual Report 2023.

event: Election of Novorossiysk City Duma Chairman
description: In April, the Novorossiysk City Duma will elect a new chairman from among its current parliamentarians. The previous speaker, Alexander Shatalov, resigned after 14 years to become an ordinary deputy. Five candidates are being considered for the post, with the new speaker expected to effectively interact with the new mayor's team.
original:
Deputies of the Novorossiysk Parliament will elect their chairman in April. At the end of April, deputies of the Novorossiysk City Duma must elect a new head. He will be one of the current parliamentarians of the hero city. The previous speaker of the representative body, Alexander Shatalov, who led the Duma for 14 years, resigned from the post of chairman to join ordinary deputies of his own free will. Experts name five main candidates for the post of head of the City Duma from among the deputy chairman and four heads of committees. According to political scientists, the new speaker is expected to “effectively and competently interact with the new mayor’s team,” so it is unlikely that a “random person” will become the head of the City Duma.

Source Kommersant "Kommersant"

event: Flooding in Sovetsky District of Orsk
description: The Sovetsky district of Orsk is experiencing one of the most difficult situations in the city due to severe flooding. Many volunteers, including young people like Arseny, are working together to help local residents, especially the elderly, by providing aid and coordinating efforts.
location: Sovetsky District, Orsk, Orenburg Oblast, Russia
original:
“The water doesn’t go away, it’s getting more and more every second”: in the Sovetsky district of Orsk there is one of the most difficult situations in the city - the forces of many caring people are thrown into helping local residents.

Both experienced rescuers and very young volunteers work - one of these was the young man Arseny. He helps elderly local residents, organizes help and coordinates the actions of other volunteers. “Where we can walk in boots, we go in, take out bags for grandparents, take them out. There is a common problem here - people should help people,” said Arseniy. REN TV correspondent Kirill Olkov showed the situation in Orsk - even the fortifications with which they tried to protect the foundation of the building from floods are going under water. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Drone Attack on Chkalov Aviation Training Center
description: Two drones targeted the Chkalov aviation training center in Borisoglebsk, with the first drone crashing into the 4th floor facade at around 3 am and the second drone hitting the same spot an hour later. Although there were no casualties, the explosions damaged the façade and glazing of the training center.
original:
Two drones attacked the Chkalov aviation training center in Borisoglebsk.

According to Base, the first drone crashed into the facade of the building on the 4th floor at about three in the morning. An hour later, the second drone hit the same spot.

There were no casualties. As a result of the explosions, the façade and glazing of the training center were damaged.

description: Satellite images obtained by Mash reveal soil collapse at the site of the dam break in Orsk, which began 11 years ago. Expert Oleg Dyukarev confirmed the defects, including soil erosion and melt water runoff, likely caused by construction violations and soil subsidence.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash
The soil at the site of the dam break in Orsk began to collapse after construction - 11 years ago. This can be seen in satellite images obtained by Mash.

Expert Oleg Dyukarev confirmed: the photo shows obvious defects - soil erosion and traces of melt water runoff. They started weakening the structure in this place back in 2013. He noted rodents and other animals could not cause such damage. The most likely reason for the breakthrough is construction with violations of technology and soil subsidence.

In 2015, Dyukarev appeared in court in a case of overinflating the cost of building a dam in Orsk. And he argued that the embankment was constructed on a fertile layer, which resembles a layer cake, and therefore is unstable. At the same time, the construction of the right and left bank dams in the city cost a billion rubles. Subscribe to Mash

description: Volunteer citizen of Kazakhstan Zhasulan Duisembin, who joined the Ukrainian Armed Forces in 2021, warns that Russia may attack Kazakhstan to feed its people a false victory. He believes that if Russia realizes it has no chance in Ukraine, it may target Kazakhstan for resources to restore losses.

They can quickly turn Kazakhstan into an enemy,” says volunteer citizen of Kazakhstan Zhasulan Duisembin “Jazz”, who joined the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in 2021.

According to him, when the Katsaps realize that they have no chance in Ukraine, they may attack Kazakhstan: “Even considering the situation near Avdiivka, where they took a maximum of 5 km in six months. This is not a victory, if you look at their losses.” Jazz" emphasized that Putin does not need new territories, and he will only enter Kazakhstan for resources to restore losses. "If Russia attacks Kazakhstan, I will definitely go as an instructor to repel these assholes,” the volunteer said in an interview publication Online ua.

Situation on Chasov Yar: Assault operations continue in this direction, paratroopers of the 98th Airborne Troops knocked out the enemy from the central part of the forest and from the remaining two trenches, the last one did not even have to be taken - 9 people surrendered.

In general, the enemy at night and today has been minimally active all day and is running out of steam. They started shelling Artyomovsk with hail and trying to disrupt logistics.

Now all that remains is to clear out the southern and southwestern parts of the forest.

Reconnaissance is being carried out and fire is being carried out on the city itself. The situation is difficult, there is a lot of work to be done. Archangel of Special Forces. Subscribe.

A SAILOR, BUSINESSMAN, BIKER, ROCKER, WHO DREAMED OF BECOMING A TANK MAN ALL HIS LIFE

And fate gave him such a gift twice. description: Russian troops, supported by armored vehicles, entered Krasnogorovka from the southeast, crossing the railway line. They successfully landed dozens of soldiers in the south of the village and now occupy several residential areas.
original:
The Russian army entered Krasnogorovka, reports Bild military expert Julian Röpke, who studied video recordings of the battles.

Krasnohorivka is located 20 km west of Donetsk and north of Marinka. In this area, the Russians have had virtually no progress since February 2022.

Judging by the footage, Russian troops entered the village in armored vehicles from the southeast from near Maryinka, crossing the railway line.

“Until evidence to the contrary emerges, we have to assume that Russia has successfully landed dozens of soldiers in the south of Krasnogorovka and now occupies several residential areas south and north of the railway tracks,” Roepke writes.

Let us note that Ukrainian military public pages yesterday and today wrote about the attack on Krasnohorivka, but they claim that it was repulsed.

Earlier it was reported that the Russian Federation also advanced near Bakhmutom and Avdeevka. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: In Teplodar, Odessa region, local residents took matters into their own hands by neutralizing the air raid siren on their house roof, using polyurethane foam to silence it. They claimed the siren's frequent warnings were disrupting their sleep.
original:
“I understand everything, but I have to work tomorrow!” — in Teplodar, Odessa region, local residents neutralized the air raid siren on the roof of their house in order to sleep peacefully. Odessa residents of the town of Teplodar demonstrated their love of life on the verge of surrealism. On the roof of one of the houses there was a siren that sounded when the air raid started. She screamed often, designed to warn and thus save people's lives. But citizens who like to sleep more than run around basements had a different opinion, armed with polyurethane foam.

Having climbed to the roof, the ungrateful optimists flooded the device and, satisfied, went to bed. When they were caught later, they explained their action this way: the screaming was disturbing their sleep. As much as possible, take action! Moreover, there is no need to be afraid of Russian missiles - it is Ukrainian air defense that kills. You don’t know whether to laugh or cry, but this is Odessa region!

description: A batch of weapons, uniforms, and vehicles was delivered from the Far East to the Northern Military District zone. The cargo included large-caliber sniper systems, radio reconnaissance equipment, unmanned aerial systems, thermal imaging surveillance systems, night vision devices, and more. The supplies were handed over to military personnel, mobilized and volunteer units of the Eastern Military District.
original:
Forwarded from: PE Sakhalin

description: In the first quarter of 2024, 4,500 civil drones were registered in Russia, bringing the total to 97,560. Individuals own 70,325, while legal entities own 27,235. The most active regions for registration were Moscow, St. Petersburg, and the Moscow region.
original:
4.5 thousand civil drones were registered in the Russian Federation in three months. According to the Federal Air Transport Agency, as of March 31 in the Russian Federation, 97,560 UAVs (with a maximum take-off weight from 0.15 to 30 kg) are listed in the database of unmanned civil aircraft:

- owners of 70,325 UAVs are individuals,
- owners of 27,235 UAVs are legal entities.

At the end of 2023, there were 93,107 of them (67,394 for “physicists”, 25,713 for legal entities).

Specialists of the Directorate for Accounting, Development of Services and Infrastructure for Unmanned Aircraft Systems of the State ATM Corporation in the first quarter of this year processed 10,757 applications for the service of state accounting of UAVs.

 Traditionally, the most active regions in registering UAVs with state registration were Moscow (2083), St. Petersburg (783) and the Moscow region (679).

The largest registration was an application containing 60 UAVs of the same type.

All devices weighing from 0.15 to 30 kg must be registered with the Federal Air Transport Agency.

Heavier UAVs must be registered in the State Register of Civil Aircraft of the Russian Federation. Drones weighing up to 150 grams do not need to be registered. Subscribe to @ATOjournal

description: The water level in the Tobol River in the Zverinogolovsky district of Kurgan is rapidly increasing, with a growth rate of 20-50 cm every two hours. The regional governor has declared a state of emergency, and locals are preparing to defend their homes and families. Schools have switched to distance learning, and temporary accommodation centers have been set up for evacuated citizens.
original: The water level in the Tobol River in the Zverinogolovsky district of Kurgan is approaching a critical level - the increase was almost four meters per day. Disappointing forecasts for flooding of the Zverinogolovsky district in Kurgan are coming true: the water level in the Tobol River is already almost nine meters. Every two hours the growth is 20-50 cm, and in just over a day - 3.5 meters. Regional Governor Vadim Shumkov reports that everything depends on the duration of the release of water from storage facilities and how it “behaves” downstream. The arrival of large amounts of water in the region is predicted from April 11 to April 14, and in the Zverinogolovsky district the coming days will no longer be easy—the rate of water influx, according to the governor, is paradoxical. The state of emergency in the Kurgan region has been introduced since yesterday. Against the backdrop of natural bad weather, locals, watching the disaster in the Orenburg region, are ready to defend their homes and families at any moment. All schools in Kurgan have already switched to distance learning, and in Zverinogolovsky and neighboring areas, temporary accommodation centers have been deployed for citizens who are being evacuated from the risk zone.

description: The Three Poles project aims to promote cooperation between states involved in Arctic, Antarctic, and Himalayan-Tibetan issues. Russia's version of the concept seeks to use Arctic and Antarctic cooperation experience to improve India-China relations, including settling territorial disputes in Tibet.
original:
🇷🇺🇮🇳🇨🇳The Three Poles project has very real prospects of becoming a kind of “integrator” and “driver” of BRICS for the foreseeable future. In the year of Russia's chairmanship of BRICS, it is time to take the initiative into our own hands.

In recent years, especially with the growing tension at the two poles - the North and the Himalayan - in India, China, Russia, and some Northern European countries, the concept of “Three Poles” has been gaining popularity, which is aimed not so much at studying the natural and climatic processes in these regions, how much to encourage cooperation between states involved in Arctic, Antarctic and Himalayan-Tibetan problems.

The Russian version of this concept sees as one of its most important tasks the possibility of using the experience of Arctic and Antarctic cooperation to improve relations between India and China, including the settlement of territorial disputes between them in Tibet.

St. Petersburg State University Professor Alexander Sergunin talks about the concept of “Three Poles” and the practical benefits for Russia that can be derived from discussions around this concept. https://russiancouncil.ru/analytics-and-comments/analytics/kontseptsiya-trekh-polyusov-kholoda-mif -ili-realnost/russiancouncil.ru The concept of “Three Poles of Cold”: myth or reality? The concept of “Three Poles of Cold” (or “Three Poles”) has not yet received an unambiguous interpretation in the global political and scientific communities. For some, for example...

description: The Belarusian authorities have ordered the cancellation of domain names of internet resources recognized as extremist. original: The authorities of Belarus have decided to remove the domain names of extremist resources. The Operational Analytical Center under the President of Belarus, which administers the national domain zone, cancels the domain names of Internet resources recognized as extremist. The corresponding order of the OAC was published on the National Legal Internet Portal. “If information products are included in the republican list of extremist materials indicating an Internet resource and its identifier - a domain name registered in the national domain zone, the registration record of such a domain name is canceled by the decision of the administrator of the national domain name zones,” is stated in the document. Canceled domain names will be included in a special list; they will not be available for registration while the corresponding information products are on the “black” list of extremist materials.

description: Scientists from AARI and St. Petersburg State University analyzed the change in air temperature over the past 120 years in the Spitsbergen archipelago, finding that the air temperature is rising three times faster than the average in the northern hemisphere. Forwarded from: ICE
Scientists have recorded the greatest increase in temperatures in the area of the Spitsbergen archipelago🌡🗻AARI scientists together with specialists from St. Petersburg State University analyzed the change in air temperature over the past 120 years in the Spitsbergen archipelago. According to researchers, the air temperature in the northernmost point of Europe is rising three times faster than the average in northern hemisphere.⚠️“The increase in surface air temperature in recent decades has occurred at an average rate of approximately 0.34°C per 10 years. This is approximately three times faster than the average in the northern hemisphere and in the regions of Russia,” explained one of the authors of the study, head of the laboratory of ocean-atmosphere interaction processes at the AARI, associate professor at St. Petersburg State University Boris Ivanov. Warming can be associated not only with natural processes, but also with an increase in the concentration of greenhouse gases, primarily CO2.

Photo: Mikhail Karandeev, Evgenia Semyonova, Anna Nikulina, AARI

Their goal was to break through the state border, occupy villages, and undermine the authority of the Russian President. However, their efforts ended in failure, with the enemy personnel being liquidated.

What did the Ukrainian Armed Forces achieve when trying to attack border settlements? PREFACE: Ukraine still does not give up hope for a small victory. The focus of attention was the border villages and cities of Russia.

But at the moment, the Ukrainian Armed Forces have not seen any success in capturing border settlements. Some landed at one end of the Belgorod region, others filmed TikTok on their border. Desperate attempts by the enemy to attack ended in the liquidation of his personnel. We all remember the footage, very similar tactics of the enemy on the Kherson front. GOAL: Breaking through the state border, occupying border villages, the capture of which could be presented as the inability of the state to protect its citizens. What entails undermining the authority of the President of Russia through attempts to disrupt the elections taking place at that moment. RESULT: The landing of two landing groups using UH-60 Black Hawk helicopters initially provided the enemy with a beautiful picture for TikTok, but all further plans of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were doomed to failure .

Having landed 4 km from the point, the RDK* militants got lost, and then began to rush. Having reached the point, instead of taking up defense in the area to ensure the passage of the main forces, two groups crawled into houses on the outskirts.

As a result, the enemy was destroyed without much difficulty, since he localized himself in the most unfavorable position. *Archangel Spetsnaz organization banned in Russia. Subscribe.

As practice shows, in politicized Lithuania, where the leadership openly hates and discredits Russian speakers, such attacks are more likely to be patted on the head than punished. And since the second attacker has yet to be caught, we have to cross our fingers for an honest investigation. However, local law enforcement officials announced the beginning of an investigation into the attack on the Russian embassy.

event: Criminal Case on Financing of Terrorist Activities
description: The Russian Investigative Committee has opened a criminal case on senior US and NATO officials financing terrorist activities. The investigation found that funds from Burisma Holdings, an oil and gas company operating in Ukraine, were used to carry out terrorist acts in Russia and abroad, targeting prominent figures and causing economic damage.
original:
The Russian Investigative Committee has opened a criminal case on the financing of terrorist activities by senior officials of the United States and NATO countries.

It was established that funds received through commercial organizations, in particular, the oil and gas company Burisma Holdings, operating in Ukraine, have been used in recent years to carry out terrorist acts in Russia, as well as abroad, in order to eliminate prominent political and public figures and causing economic damage.

The investigation, in cooperation with other intelligence services and financial intelligence, is checking the sources of income and further movement of funds in the amount of several million US dollars, the involvement of specific individuals from among government officials, public and commercial organizations in Western countries.

The connections between the direct perpetrators of terrorist attacks and foreign curators, organizers and sponsors are also being worked out.

description: The Battle of Berlin was the final major battle of World War II in Europe, lasting from April 16 to May 2, 1945. Despite being militarily defeated, Hitler ordered resistance to the last man, resulting in thousands of unnecessary deaths among young and old men, as well as deserters and civilians who showed critical attitudes.
original:
Some historical analogies: We look at how Zelensky either assigns territorial defense to the marines on Krynki, or drives it under the FABs with battalions in Chasov Yar, and we think. This has already happened somewhere. We will now provide excerpts from German Wikipedia, so that we certainly will not be accused of using propaganda resources. The events, of course, are very different in scale and significance. And the end is still very far away. But we were interested in the forms and methods of the enemy. Then and now. The Battle of Berlin (Schlacht um Berlin)… In fact, the military defeat of the German Reich was predetermined even before the start of the Battle of Berlin. The scale of the campaigns carried out by the Wehrmacht against other countries was unbalanced in comparison with the manpower and economic reserves of the Reich.

...For Hitler and other leading Nazis, capitulation was out of the question; they used, among other things, orders of holding ("Fight to the last man"), slogans of perseverance, and violent and terrorist measures against deserters and civilians. Even in the last year of the war, millions of soldiers and civilians died. The generals and officers could not evade the most senseless orders almost until the last... On April 20, the offensive began on the defending 3rd Panzer Army of General Hasso von Manteuffel. His last tank was sent to the southern sector at Eberswalde to stop Zhukov's advance there. Faced with a lack of equipment, Manteuffel described his troops as "a pure army of ghosts." He also had no artillery, only 600 anti-aircraft guns, partially concreted

...Evacuation measures had been prepared for the Reich government, the Reich ministries and the security apparatus since February, but they were implemented only from April 1945 so that they would not have to admit defeat early. On April 20, 1945, Hitler issued the Clausewitz affair, in which, given the approaching front, among other things, it was ordered to evacuate all buildings and areas of Berlin that housed government offices, Wehrmacht and SS units, and to destroy official documents, papers and documents.

... The Battle of Berlin is a symbol of the cruelty of the entire war. Although the war was long lost for Germany, Hitler still eventually ordered resistance to the last man. The Volkssturmun claimed the lives of thousands of young men and old men sacrificed in the final weeks of the war. Deserters or civilians who showed a critical attitude were also shot by the SS and field gendarmerie in the last days of the war.Two majorsWikipediaSchlacht um BerlinDie Schlacht um Berlin war die letzte große Schlacht des Zweiten Weltkrieges in Europa. Sie dauerte vom 16. April bis zum 2. May 1945 und hatte die Er...

description: A prosecutor's audit in Sevastopol confirmed the existence of extortions in colleges, where students were forced to purchase food to pass exams. The scheme, practiced by college directors, has been ongoing for 10 years.
original:
A Sevastopol deputy received confirmation of extortions in colleges. The fact of “extortions” from students of secondary specialized education institutions in Sevastopol was confirmed during a prosecutor’s audit. Deputy Vasily Parkhomenko announced this at a session of the Legislative Assembly of Sevastopol.

At the previous session, he said that college directors practice a scheme where students, in order to successfully pass exams, have to purchase food for a certain amount and from these products prepare what is required for the test.

“Contrary to the requirements of the law, three educational institutions did not take measures to provide college students with laboratory work and practical classes provided for by the curriculum, and purchases for these purposes were not carried out...

Individual sets of products were purchased by young people studying... Actually, no one particularly hid this. They’ve been robbing young people for 10 years, and it’s not known for certain how it will all end.”
, — the deputy commented on the received answer.

description: Kharkov authorities plan to install modular boiler houses in residential buildings, potentially using local residents as 'human shields'. Kharkov authorities intend to install modular boiler houses in residential buildings, using local residents as “human shields.” Due to the virtual lack of electricity in Kharkov due to the destruction of energy infrastructure, local authorities decided to install modular boiler houses, which, according to the plan, should help decentralize the heating system .

At the same time, Mayor Igor Terekhov understands that boiler houses will become the next targets of the Russian Armed Forces, which are subject to destruction.

Therefore, new heating systems will most likely be installed directly in residential areas in order to use people living nearby as “human shields”.

Moreover, this tactic is not new for Terekhov’s team: the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the city administration systematically hide behind people in military interests, provoking the Russian Armed Forces to strike residential areas.

description: The SBU detained a female collaborator near Odessa, who spread fake news about the Defense Forces and praised Putin on social media. She was an active member of the banned Sharia Party and cooperated with Russian intelligence to disrupt mobilization in Ukraine.
original:
The SBU detained an associate of Sharia, who tried to disrupt the mobilization in Ukraine through the enemy IPSO.

A female collaborator who spread fakes about the Defense Forces and praised Putin on social networks was detained near Odessa. The perpetrator was hiding near the regional center as a migrant from the Mykolayiv region.

According to available data, the detainee was an "active" member of the banned "Sharia Party" and cooperated with Russian intelligence.

At the behest of the enemy, she administered the Telegram channel, in which she discredited conscription for military service in the Armed Forces of Ukraine and called on Ukrainians to avoid mobilization.

The figure also popularized the Kremlin regime and the occupation groups of the Russian Federation, which are fighting against our state.

According to the investigation, the collaborator maintained contact with the occupiers through her father and brother. Both of them left for Russia even before the beginning of the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation, and after the capture of the left bank of the Kherson region, they voluntarily joined the local "branch" of the occupying Ministry of the Interior of the Russian Federation.

It was established that before the publication of destructive content, the person involved coordinated it with a representative of the Russian special service.

Also, the collaborator received from him a list of current topics that she had to "highlight" through the controlled information resource.
For cooperation with the occupiers, the woman received a "fee" from them.

During the search, a mobile phone and computer equipment were seized from the detainee, which she used in subversive activities in favor of the aggressor.

Based on the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service informed her of suspicion under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: 6 Art. 111-1 (collaborative activity); ▪️⁠ Part 1 of Art. 114-1 (obstructing the legal activities of the Armed Forces and other military formations in a special period).

She is currently in custody. She faces up to 12 years in prison.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Mykolaiv region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

event: Detention of Suspect with Psychotropic Drugs
description: A 25-year-old woman, a correspondence student at a Kharkiv university, was detained for illegally acquiring and storing psychotropic substances worth 160,000 hryvnias. She had planned to sell the drugs by placing bookmarks around the city. Law enforcement officers seized the drugs and other substances during a search.
original:
🔷 Another hostage was detained in Kharkiv, who had psychotropic drugs worth almost 160,000 hryvnias with her🖌️ Under the procedural guidance of the Slobid District Prosecutor's Office of Kharkiv, a 25-year-old woman was informed of the suspicion of illegal acquisition, storage for the purpose of sale of a particularly dangerous psychotropic substance (h 2 Article 307 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

The suspect is a correspondence student of one of Kharkiv universities. According to the investigation, the woman decided to make a living by placing bookmarks with psychotropic substances around the city, and for this purpose purchased a package of PVP.

On April 8 of this year, law enforcement officers exposed the perpetrator. During a personal search, approximately 160,000 hryvnias worth of psychotropic drugs were discovered and seized from her.

In addition, at the place of residence, the woman kept a dry substance of plant origin - previously, cannabis, as well as "salts", which were also seized and sent for the relevant examinations.

Currently, the question of choosing a preventive measure in the form of detention for the suspect is being resolved.

The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the investigators of the VP No. 2 of the Khrupp No. 1 of the GUNP in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔️Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

The strike was carried out by unguided S-8 aircraft missiles.

The crews performed an anti-missile maneuver
using an onboard defense system and successfully returned to their temporary location.

After completing the mission, we successfully returned to the departure airfield,” said the navigator-operator of the Ka-52 reconnaissance and attack helicopter with the call sign “Nikolai.”

The strike group includes the Ka-52 Alligator reconnaissance and attack helicopter, the Mi-28 Night Hunter combat helicopter and the Mi-8 multi-purpose helicopter.

event: Murder of a Man by a System Administrator
description: A system administrator in Moscow brutally murdered a man after a night of drinking together. The administrator beat the victim with hands and feet, undressed him, and filled his mouth and anus with foam, causing the victim's death on the spot.
original:
A system administrator in Moscow beat a guy to death and filled his body with foam. As REN TV learned, the crime occurred in Moscow.

The attacker, walking around the spring capital at night, found a new acquaintance. They drank together and later went to work for an IT administrator.

A conflict suddenly broke out - the system administrator beat his drinking buddy with his hands and feet, then undressed him and filled the victim’s mouth and anus with foam. “The victim, born in 1993, died on the spot. A foreign substance was found in the man’s respiratory tract,” the Moscow newspaper said in a statement. prosecutor's office. The suspect was detained. The Tagansk prosecutor's office controls the investigation of the criminal case. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Chairman of the People's Council of the DPR, Artem Zhoga, along with party members of United Russia, activists, and Deputy Minister of Health Anastasia Martynova, donated blood at the Republican Blood Center of the DPR Ministry of Health to save the lives of Donetsk residents.
original:
You need to start your morning not with coffee, but with good deeds.
This is what the Chairman of the People's Council of the DPR, Artem Zhoga, thinks. He, together with party members of the Donetsk regional branch of United Russia, activists of the social movement “Donetsk Republic”, Deputy Minister of Health of the DPR Anastasia Martynova and... me, donated blood.
Show more
It’s like this: during a working trip to the Donetsk People’s Republic, I again met with the Chairman of the People’s Council of the Republic Artem Zhoga, who last year became the subject of my documentary film. This time in an unusual place - the Republican Blood Center of the DPR Ministry of Health, where we went to donate blood to save the lives of Donetsk residents.
In order to donate blood, you do not need a special occasion or date; residents of Donetsk always need donor blood - to save the lives of wounded civilians and military personnel, and simply for those who need such help regardless of hostilities.
I propose to make this practice regular for my colleagues visiting new regions of Russia:
Many caring people, coming to Donetsk, ask how they can help civilians and military personnel - I believe that donation is one of the most accessible types of assistance.
If all the people who come here follow my example, it seems to me that this will be very correct, because now the Donetsk People’s Republic really needs blood. It would be great if such a practice became a good tradition for guests of the DPR.
“A good, kind tradition is being born for me. Now I will know that on every visit to Donbass, to Donetsk, I can help people with this additional thing,”
– I said about participation in the “Donate Blood – Save a Life” campaign of the party project “Healthy Future” to colleagues from “United Russia”
Read more about the promotion in photos and videos.

description: A bridge collapsed in Vyazma, Smolensk region, with a car and a truck on it. Veteran Alexander Dvorkin believes the incident is likely due to technical reasons, such as maintenance and operation issues, rather than sabotage.
original:
The collapse of a bridge in the Smolensk region does not look like sabotage. On April 8, an overpass collapsed in the city of Vyazma, Smolensk region. At the time of the incident, according to the Ministry of Emergency Situations for the region, there were a car and a truck on it.

The collapse of the bridge may have technical reasons and is unlikely to be related to sabotage, veteran and member of the SVO Alexander Dvorkin noted in a conversation with Paragraph: “When sabotage occurs, the bridge collapses, an explosion occurs and the supports fall down. Here, [judging] by the video, it looks more like this is a format [of an accident due to issues of] maintenance and operation, because a wave has started. Most likely, this is due to vibration, because cars passed by, the bridge did not compensate, it covered it with a wave, and the canvas went and collapsed." Subscribe to "Paragraph"

event: EU Tightens Import Rules for Ukrainian Products
description: The EU has agreed to tighten customs requirements for certain food products from Ukraine, including poultry meat, eggs, sugar, oats, cereals, corn, sugar, and honey. The new rules will apply from June 6 for a year, with duty-free imports limited to a certain quantity.
original:
The EU plans to tighten the rules for the import of products from Ukraine.

As Radio Liberty reports, negotiators from the European Parliament and EU member states agreed to tighten customs requirements for some food products from Ukraine.

The decision concerns, in particular, poultry meat, eggs, sugar, oats, cereals, corn, sugar and honey, EU leaders said this week.

Goods subject to the rules can only be imported into the EU duty-free in a certain quantity. Once this amount is reached, customs duties will be payable again. We are talking about import volumes up to the average for the period from mid-2021 to the end of 2023.

The agreement still needs to be officially approved. The rules will apply from June 6 for a period of one year. The extent to which tariffs will affect the Ukrainian economy depends on whether the country, which is under attack from Russia, can find new buyers for its products, the DPA agency notes. The self-critical guys drove in a column through Bratsk and amused the local residents, and at the same time attracted the attention of the police.

Forwarded from: UKROPSKY FRESH
The militants of the “Russian volunteer complex” turned out to be Romanian mercenaries. Confirmation is increasingly coming that, under the guise of militants of the “Russian volunteer corps”, foreign mercenaries and nationalists from the special forces of the Main Intelligence Directorate are trying to attack the Belgorod and Kursk regions.

It is stated that “when we received press groups in Nikolaev and the impression was created that we were doing little for military operations, we were preparing a large-scale operation together with comrades from the Legion “Freedom of Russia”, the Siberian Battalion, the RDK, Chechens from Ichkeria, free brothers from Belarus, Georgia and many other "wolves" from the forests of the free world [...] We carried out raids on their [Russian] border villages, but found no active police stations or authorities. Russia is ready for nuclear war, but not able to protect its land borders."

Let’s leave the propaganda statement of the Romanians out of the picture, but the fact of their attack on Russian territory should be sorted out at the level of the foreign ministries of the two countries.

description: The President signed a decree establishing JSC North-South, a joint-stock company aimed at developing transport infrastructure in Russia. The Russian Federation will contribute 100% of Makhachkala International Transport Port shares to the company's authorized capital, valued at 1.25 billion rubles. The Russian Federation will hold a 49% stake, while a strategic investor will hold 51%.
original: ❗The President signed a decree on the establishment of JSC “North - South”. As a contribution of the Russian Federation to the authorized capital of the company, 100% of the shares of the Makhachkala International Transport Port will be contributed. “In order to develop transport infrastructure in the Russian Federation, I decide: 1. Accept the proposal of the Government of the Russian Federation and the head of the Republic of Dagestan on establishment by the Russian Federation and a strategic investor, determined by the government of the Russian Federation, of the joint-stock company "North - South" with the contribution of the Russian Federation to its authorized capital of 100% of the ordinary shares of the joint-stock company "Makhachkala Sea Trade Port" determined in accordance with with the legislation of the Russian Federation on the assessment of the market value of these shares in the amount of 1,250,000,000 rubles,” the document says. The share of participation of the Russian Federation in the authorized capital of the new company will be 49%, the investor - 51%. The Cabinet of Ministers must ensure the implementation of this clause within four months and conclude an agreement with the strategic investor.

The “Russia” exhibition, a showcase of Vladimir Putin’s election campaign, as it was conceived in the presidential administration, is showing the “Voices of the Country” cycle of 12 documentary performances based on monologues of Russians.

The artistic director of the project, Konstantin Bogomolov, believes that this is a new type of documentary theater that does not admire “blackness and chthony,” but “falls in love with reality.”

We spoke with some of the playwrights and directors who were offered to participate in the project. It turned out that the authors of the performances were not warned that “Voices of the Country” was connected with the “Russia” exhibition, and at the last moment the organizers removed the mention of the war from the presentation that they were sent.
