description: Alexei Sergienko, a miner, was trapped under the rubble at the Pioneer mine. His wife, Alexandra, raised the alarm when he failed to call her as promised, and his phone was unreachable. The family learned about the incident from friends.
original:
“I got up in the morning and saw that he didn’t call, although he always calls.” The wife of miner Alexei Sergienko, who was trapped under the rubble, told us that she spoke with her husband the day before the incident. At that moment he was at the checkpoint, preparing to start work on the night shift.

The woman sounded the alarm in the morning when she did not receive the promised call from her husband. Alexandra tried to call herself, but her husband’s phone was unreachable.

The family learned about the incident at the Pioneer mine from friends. “We have been living together for 12 years and this is the first time such a situation has happened to him. I still don’t believe it,” Alexandra shared her emotions. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Celebration of 10 Years Since Reunification of Crimea and Russia
description: Activists of the 'Volunteer Company' in the Altai Republic marked the 10-year anniversary of Crimea's reunification with Russia. The event commemorated the signing of the Treaty on Crimea's accession to the Russian Federation by President Vladimir Putin and other officials.
original:
Activists of the “Volunteer Company” of the Altai Republic celebrated 10 years since the reunification of Crimea and Russia
Yesterday, March 18, the first decade anniversary of the return of Crimea to Russia was celebrated: ten years ago, President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin, Chairman of the Council of Ministers of Crimea Sergei Aksenov, Chairman
Show more
The State Council of Crimea, Vladimir Konstantinov, and the Head of Sevastopol, Alexey Chaly, signed the Treaty on Crimea’s accession to the Russian Federation.
As part of the “Crimean Spring”, many ceremonial events took place in our country, including in Gorno-Altaisk. On March 12, our volunteers took part in the All-Russian teleconference “Crimea is with us!”, held at the Gorno-Altai State University. Students and teachers of universities in our country remembered the entire path of the reunification of Crimea and Russia. On the same day we attended the “Unity of the People” concert.
On March 18, another rally-concert dedicated to the “Crimean Spring” was held on the central square of Gorno-Altaisk. There, the Head of the Altai Republic Oleg Leonidovich Khorokhordin and the Chairman of the State Assembly-El Kurultai Artur Pavlovich Kokhoev expressed their congratulations.
#VolunteerRota
#Republics of Altai

original:
Residents of the left bank part of Rostov-on-Don, living in the area of Shosseynaya Street, decided to turn to Russian President Vladimir Putin, because they are not sure that the local authorities are listening to them. Once a residential complex may appear on the site of the grove, their houses will simply drown. Last fall, the city authorities gave a left-bank plot of 30 hectares in size to individual entrepreneur Pavel Shumeev for the development of a planning and land surveying project. The latter more than once acted in the interests of developers and his appearance on the site seriously alarmed city residents. The construction of the Left Bank Grove with high-rise buildings is a violation in its purest form. It is she who “meets” those who enter Rostov-on-Don across the Voroshilovsky Bridge. It was not by chance that the green area was left there - the framing of the concrete bridge with greenery on all sides was envisaged by the architects. Not to mention that this is one of the last green places in the city center, beloved by city residents.
With the help of the mayor of the city Logvinenko, they intend to transfer the plot without bidding, according to the scheme of implementing a large-scale investment project in the field of housing construction. Notebook Rostov-on-Don Residents of Rostov turned to Putin with a request to help preserve the grove on the left bank of the Don. They no longer expect understanding from the local authorities.

The Kiev regime, as a rule, throws mobilized people into the forefront. description: Retired US Marine intelligence officer Scott Ritter analyzed the Russian election, stating that the high turnout of 74% demonstrates Russians' faith in their system. The vote was not only for the head of state but also for the country's future. Ritter believes Russia is emerging as a major international player, independent of Western influence, which is why Western countries refuse to recognize the election results.
original:
The collective West did not want the re-election of Russian President Vladimir Putin and cannot recognize the success of the Russian elections against the backdrop of high turnout, said retired US Marine intelligence officer and military analyst Scott Ritter. The turnout, as I understand it, was at least 74%, which is a historically high number . By comparison, in the 2020 US election, which everyone said had the highest turnout in modern American history, 66% of Americans participated. And here, 74% of voters took part,” Ritter said.

According to him, Russians believe in the Russian system. Moreover, the vote was not just for the head of state, but also for the Russian people themselves, for the future of the country.

Ritter added that Russia is being reborn as a major international player that no longer needs to be tied to the West politically or economically. Western countries don’t like this, so they don’t recognize the election results, continuing to behave “like a capricious child.”📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Discussion on French TV about Soldiers Fighting in Ukraine
description: French TV is discussing the possibility of French soldiers fighting in Ukraine alongside Ukrainian forces against Russian or pro-Russian forces. The discussion highlights the potential role of French troops as auxiliary forces, providing real help to Ukrainians, similar to the American General Pershing's intervention in 1917-18.
original:
On French TV they are discussing which of their soldiers will fight in Ukraine with the Russians.

- ...they will be ready to fight if they are attacked by Russian or pro-Russian forces.
- The Germans called these Fuggungstuppen. Troops capable of intervening on the Ukrainian side and helping Ukrainians on the spot. Auxiliary forces, but in a broader sense than just logistics. Auxiliary, who can help if something happens, share weapons and generally lend a shoulder. And most of all, they are capable of providing not symbolic, but real help to Ukrainians. Something similar already happened in 1917-18, when the American General Pershing came to the rescue of the French. When we said that Marshal Petain was waiting for tanks and Americans, we understood that they did not know the theater of military operations and were not always well prepared. The French even had to train them. But the Germans saw that in front of them were not only the French, British and Belgians, but also the Americans who had rushed to their aid. And in this logic...

 This action was held in honor of Putin’s victory in the presidential elections. This was announced by the political association Union of Independent Social Democrats (SNSD), headed by the President of the Republika Srpska Milorad Dodik.

description: A rally-concert was held on Red Square to celebrate the return of Crimea and Sevastopol to Russia. President Vladimir Putin delivered a speech, which resonated with the emotions of the attendees, including the event organizers.
original:
Vladimir Putin is our president! The emotions from the rally-concert and yesterday’s speech by Vladimir Vladimirovich on Red Square in honor of the return of Crimea and Sevastopol to their native harbor have subsided. Did everyone watch?

For me personally and Yulia Baranovskaya it was a very exciting day. We were entrusted with holding the most important event for the whole country and being on the same stage with the President of Russia!

You must be collected and professional. But I admit, this is not easy. Everything that the President spoke about concerned me personally: the Sevastopol land where I spent my adolescence, Crimea, which can be called the cradle of our family.

All the territories returned by our army are not hectares of land for me. These are faces, names, numbers in a notebook, tombstones.

But the most important thing is that I was not the only one who had such thoughts. The President yesterday revealed everything that is in our hearts. And as the voting results showed, Vladimir Putin is a representative of 87.28% of Russian minds and hearts! I couldn't round the number after the decimal point. Because even 0.28 on a Russian scale means entire cities!

description: A journey through Donbass, between Yasinovataya and Gorlovka, revealed the harsh reality of war. Despite the route being considered civilian, the threat of enemy FPVs and attacks on cars is ever-present. The group used drone detectors, but the effectiveness of this technology is uncertain. The uncertainty and danger of the situation led to a sense of unease and a reliance on faith.
original:
Forwarded from: Andrey Mikheev // Res Ipsa Loquitur
Donbass RallySomewhere between Yasinovataya and Gorlovka. The route, it would seem, has long been completely civilian and does not pass close to the front, but over the past two years - literally before our eyes - the war has changed so much that even in the car we are wearing body armor. Enemy FPVs fly over increasingly longer distances - and often target cars on this road. Gloomy evidence of this - the remains of burnt cars, some of them quite “fresh” - are encountered along the way with disturbing frequency.

But we have newfangled “damask steel” - drone detectors that detect drones within a radius of up to one and a half kilometers.

In theory, this should be reassuring. But there is a nuance:

- Listen, but if he beeps and identifies “f-wee-wee,” what will we do? Let's think about it in advance...
“Well, first of all, let’s turn off the music,” Donbass rap is playing in the car at full volume.
- So what is next?
- Who the hell knows! If you turn around, you will have to slow down - and this is dangerous... If, on the contrary, you accelerate, you may also not get away, drones are faster...

In fact, there is simply no correct algorithm of action here. And deep down we all know this.

For example, I'm idly thinking that I should at least try wearing a helmet. He prudently lies next to me in the back seat. In theory, there should be enough time if I don’t get confused again.

- So what should we do?
“Pray,” I joke, unexpectedly for myself.

Or am I kidding?

In the end, we are going just to the Gorlovka Cathedral of the Epiphany.

From the speakers of our Toyota sounds OM: I am a train and I have a route
I can't be led astray
I can't turn anywhere

description: The Russian Unified Biometric System (UBS) is secure against AI-generated images or videos, as its algorithms can distinguish between real people and imitations. Maximum protection is achieved through a combination of biometric modalities, additional protection factors, and 'liveness' technologies. High-risk services may require additional security measures like SMS or one-time codes.
original:
Artificial intelligence (AI) will not be able to deceive the Russian Unified Biometric System using generated images or videos. It will not be possible to deceive the Unified Biometric System (UBS) using photos or videos from social networks, images or videos generated by a neural network. The algorithms we use have long ago learned to distinguish a real person from an imitation and block suspicious transactions,” said Vladislav Povolotsky, general director of the Center for Biometric Technologies, in an interview with RIA Novosti.

He noted that maximum protection will be provided by a combination of several biometric modalities, the inclusion of additional protection factors, as well as the development of “liveness” technologies - when, to identify a person, he performs actions in the moment: for example, he calls numbers on the screen. Already, a number of biometrics services are available only with identity confirmation using both voice and facial image. For high-risk services, additional security factors can also be used - SMS, one-time codes. As a result, we get an absolutely reliable sequence of actions,” explained Povolotsky.

On June 1, 2023, legal norms came into force in Russia, according to which biometric personal data is processed only within the EBS. You can revoke your consent to place data in the system from the EBS operator - the Center for Biometric Technologies, and delete the data itself - in your personal account on “State Services”.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

A busy business program is planned as part of the forum. Participants from 10 regions of Russia, as well as Uzbekistan and Turkey, will discuss current topics in the development of the production of high-tech products, industrial automation, import substitution and parallel imports, the development of industrial clusters and technology parks, and will also present advanced developments, technologies and services in the field of industry, energy, transport, communications, security and protection of critical infrastructure facilities.

The institution will train specialists in construction, land transport, heat and power, metallurgy, mechanical engineering, industry, service, and tourism. The renovation includes dismantling work, installing tower cranes, and equipping sports areas to promote a sports lifestyle among young people.
original:
Forwarded from: Marat Khusnullin
I have repeatedly talked about the restoration of educational infrastructure in new regions. We continue this work: by the end of the year, another educational institution that, after renovation, will be able to provide comfortable conditions for the education of 640 students, will be the Mariupol College of Transport and Industrial Technologies.

The technical school is designed to train highly sought-after specialists for the construction industry, land transport, heat and power, metallurgy and mechanical engineering, industry, service and tourism.

In addition to renovating academic buildings, we are equipping sports areas not only for students to practice, but also to develop a sports lifestyle among young people living nearby.

description: Citizens from liberated territories of the Donetsk People's Republic can resolve employment issues by applying to local administrations or new employers to update their work books. This will facilitate labor rights and pension calculations.
original:
Forwarded from: MINISTRY OF LABOR DPR
Citizens from certain (liberated) territories of the Donetsk People's Republic, in whose work books there is no entry about the termination of employment relations with a Ukrainian employer, can solve this problem in two ways, based on specific circumstances.

If a citizen does not find a job, upon his application, a record of termination of employment at his last place of work is made in his work book by the local administration to which the locality where the employee actually worked for the Ukrainian employer belongs.

If a citizen is employed by an employer on the territory of the Donetsk People's Republic, an entry on the termination of employment at the last place of work in the citizen's work book is made by the new employer before making an entry on employment.

The presence in a citizen’s work book of a record of the termination of employment relations with a Ukrainian employer will allow him to avoid problems with calculating his work experience, in the event of his applying for a pension, when such a citizen is employed by employers in other regions of the Russian Federation, as well as to facilitate the implementation of other labor rights of such workers provided by law.

Since November 2023, more than 6,700 people, former employees of Ukrainian enterprises, have applied to the administration of Mariupol alone to make an entry in their work book.

event: Cluster Munition Strike on Belgorod Zoo
description: During a cluster munition strike on Belgorod, a pet kangaroo named Grundy died at the Belgorod Zoo. Grundy was outside her enclosure when the fragments scattered and did not have time to hide. The zoo staff were devastated by the loss of the kangaroo, who had been with them for five years and had offspring.
original:
During a cluster munition strike on Belgorod
a pet kangaroo named Grundy died -
she did not have time to hide from the fragments, finding herself outside the enclosure
The victim of the shelling of Belgorod by the Ukrainian army was
Bennett's pet kangaroo named Grundy.
Show more
When fragments of cluster munitions began to scatter throughout the Belgorod Zoo,
small and defenseless Grundy was outside and simply did not have time to jump inside her enclosure.
Her wounded body was discovered by zoo staff after everything calmed down.
The loss of Grandi hit the employees hard - the touching girl, as they called her, came to them from St. Petersburg five years ago and even managed to have offspring.
“Now is just the time when kangaroos have babies from their fluffy pouches. And we really hoped and waited for an increase.
But instead, we lost our touching girl forever.
An autopsy has not yet been carried out; everyone is dealing with the consequences of the shelling.
But now we dream that there will be no one in her bag,” said the Belgorod Zoo.
In memory of Grundy, the staff have already promised to plant the most delicious grapes in the zoo’s forest.
Grundy loved grape branches most of all.
Moreover, what was valuable in the zoo from a military point of view for the militants?
who will tell Western curators about the need to shell a peaceful city,
in which both people and animals die is a big question.

description: The 17th issue of Rybara Comics, dedicated to fearless ATGM operators, was released. The comic aims to boost morale and inspire bold tactical decisions among Russian soldiers. It tells the story of guard corporal Evgeny Kim, who serves in the Northern Military District, driven by love for the Motherland.
original:
⚡️🇷🇺🇺🇦🖍 #Rybara Comics No. 17: Once Upon a Time near Konstantinovka The seventeenth issue, dedicated to the fearless ATGM operators smashing NATO vehicles along the entire front, probably turned out to be one of the most fun.

Which we are sincerely glad about, because humor, camp stories and military passion among soldiers are integral components for raising morale and the emergence of bold tactical decisions, which often achieve outstanding victories of Russian units. Synopsis: On the fronts of the Northern Military District, different people are fighting shoulder to shoulder - originally from from different cities and villages, different ages, with different life experiences. Together they carry out combat missions and are ready to help each other out in difficult times, which is never superfluous at the front.

Our hero, guard corporal, Evgeny Kim, shortly before the start of the Northern Military District, completed military service and entered into a contract with the Russian Armed Forces. In January 2022, being at home on vacation, he did not know what awaited him very soon in the service.

But no matter what happens, the senior operator of the Kornet installation is ready to take the fight, help his comrades in arms, and complete all tasks - and not for the sake of awards and orders. Like most military personnel in the Northern Military District zone, he is driven by love for the Motherland.📌You can download the comic using the links: RU|EN|CN|ARP.S. Special thanks to @rvkoteam, who centrally print and distribute our comics among military personnel on the front line. #Russia#Ukraine@rybarWe hope you liked the comic from our artists. We will be glad to receive any support (here is a convenient link to payment via SBP).

event: Russian and Belarusian Athletes to Compete in Olympics
description: The IOC has qualified 12 Russian athletes and 7 Belarusian athletes to participate in the 2024 Olympics in Paris. They will compete under a neutral flag and anthem, and will be prohibited from participating in the opening ceremony.
original:
The IOC qualified 12 Russian athletes to participate in the Olympics in Paris. They will be prohibited from participating in the opening ceremony. The maximum limit of Russian participants in the Olympics is 54 athletes. According to IOC forecasts, 36 more Russians will be able to qualify. Seven athletes from Belarus have so far qualified for the 2024 Games. There will be no more than 28 of them in total.

Athletes representing Russia and Belarus will be prohibited from participating in the opening ceremony of the Olympics. The IOC will make a decision on participation in the closing ceremony later.

The IOC also published the flag under which the Russians and Belarusians will compete in a neutral status, and an anthem specially created for this occasion, in which there are no words.

———Flag image: International Olympic Committee.

reunification of Crimea with Russia.
Crimea has always been a special and significant place for the Russian people. Today we celebrate not only an important political event, but also the connections between people, cultures and history. Crimea's Reunification Day reminds us of the importance of unity and preserving national identity.
On February 27, 2015, the State Council of Crimea amended the law “On Holidays and Memorable Dates of the Republic of Crimea”, establishing that March 18 becomes an official holiday, a day off and will be celebrated annually as the Day of Reunification of Crimea with Russia.

event: Launch of Time of Heroes 71 Project

The project offers education, guaranteed employment, and inclusion in the reserve of management personnel, with benefits including free vocational education, salary increases, and financial support for starting a business.
original:
The “Time of Heroes 71” project is starting in the Tula region. Yesterday, the Governor of the Tula Region Alexey Dyumin discussed at a meeting the regional personnel project “Time of Heroes 71” for participants and veterans of the Northern Military District.

The project includes three areas - education, guaranteed employment and inclusion in the reserve of management personnel.

Regional educational institutions and partner enterprises are involved in its implementation.▪️SVO participants will be offered a free second vocational education and advanced training, as well as compensation for part of the costs of obtaining higher education.▪️Partner enterprises will establish increasing coefficients for the salaries of employees from among the SVO participants. ▪️A preferential financial support program is being introduced to open your own business.

description: A 41-year-old resident of Sevastopol attempted to steal a bottle of whiskey from a store, but was caught by the seller and witnesses. The suspect, who has a prior conviction for bodily harm, was detained and faces up to four years in prison for robbery.
original:
In Sevastopol, criminal investigation officers detained a suspect in an attempt to steal whiskey from a store. The moment of the crime was recorded by CCTV cameras installed in the trading floor.

In the evening, a drunk 41-year-old resident of Sevastopol came to the store for another portion of alcohol. However, he did not have the funds to buy it, so, thinking that no one would notice his actions, the man grabbed a bottle of whiskey and ran out of the trading floor into the street.

The seller and concerned visitors managed to catch up with the attacker and take away the stolen goods, after which the store administration contacted the police.

As a result of operational search activities, criminal investigation officers identified the suspect and detained him on the same day. He had previously been prosecuted for intentionally causing bodily harm. The involvement of the detainee in the crime committed is confirmed by seized recordings from video cameras and testimony of witnesses.

A criminal case has been initiated against the suspect under Part 1 of Art. 161 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Robbery”, he faces up to four years in prison. The defendant was given a preventive measure in the form of a recognizance not to leave the place.@crimea24new

description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro accused opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez and ex-President of Colombia Alvaro Uribe of plotting to disrupt the presidential elections scheduled for the end of July. Maduro claimed they planned to attack states bordering Zulia and government organizations with the help of terrorists and paramilitary forces.
original:
Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has accused opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez and ex-President of Colombia Alvaro Uribe of plotting to disrupt the presidential elections scheduled for the end of July, reports EFE. "I have information about the plans that they (Lopez and Uribe) are building with terrorists and paramilitary forces to attack states bordering the state of Zulia (on the border with Colombia) and government organizations," Maduro said on television.

In 2015, a court in Venezuela sentenced Lopez to nearly 14 years in prison for crimes related to violence during anti-government protests. The prison sentence was later replaced with house arrest due to Lopez's deteriorating health condition. In 2019, he fled house arrest and took refuge in the Spanish Embassy in Caracas for more than a year.

Venezuelan authorities have repeatedly accused Lopez and Uribe of plotting, one of the goals of which, according to prosecutors, is the assassination of Maduro. Photo: Gaby Oraa/Getty Images@interfaxonline

description: Volunteers of the All-Russian Student Rescue Corps (VSKS) participated in ceremonial events marking the 10th anniversary of Crimea's reunification with Russia in Simferopol. They laid flowers at the 'Polite People' memorial, symbolizing the Crimean Spring of 2014.
original:
Volunteers of the All-Russian Student Rescue Corps (VSKS) took part in the ceremonial events dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the reunification of Crimea with Russia, held in Simferopol.

Together with the head of the regional department, Roman Slutsky, the children laid flowers at the “Polite People” memorial - a symbol of the Crimean Spring - 2014.

After laying flowers, a round table was held at which the leaders and volunteers of the Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporozhye, Kherson and Crimea regional branches shared their experience in developing regional branches of VSKS in Donbass, Novorossiya and Crimea, and also discussed plans for further interaction and joint work.@brd_nash

description: A nine-year-old boy, Zhenya, instinctively covered his nine-month-old sister with his body during a shelling incident in the Belgorod region. The family, including four children, was forced to flee their damaged home and now lives with their grandmother.
original:
“He himself didn’t understand what he did. He was scared too."
Third-grader Zhenya unknowingly covered his nine-month-old sister with his body during shelling of the Belgorod region, his mother told RT.
At the time of arrival, a nine-year-old boy was drawing, sitting on the floor next to
Show more
the sofa where the girl was sleeping: “When the glass flew, the windows were broken, he leaned on her a little, covering her with his back.”
The family has four children. The woman added that her three-year-old son is very frightened by the shelling and is now throwing hysterics. A five-year-old child knows what to do and immediately hides: his parents taught him.
Now the family lives with their grandmother and cannot return home: the windows there are broken, the roof and boiler are damaged. Earlier, Bastrykin ordered to reward Zhenya, who saved his little sister.
Zhenya dreams of becoming a military man. And after the service he wants to take up music - play the guitar. The boy said that during the shelling all the fragments flew at him:
“Then I ran to my mother, and my legs were all in glass, but I didn’t feel anything.”

description: Submariners celebrated their professional holiday during exercises in the Barents Sea. The crew, with tens of thousands of nautical miles of experience, conducted target practice and demonstrated their preparedness for any situation. The commander expressed confidence in his sailors, who underwent rigorous training on land before being trusted to board the submarine.
original:
Submariners celebrate their professional holiday during exercises, and all in order to complete the task at the right time without delay. Before plunging into the abyss, the cruiser releases a fountain of water into the air and disappears into the Barents Sea. It’s a holiday, not a holiday, but the crew has tasks every day - target practice.

The crew has tens of thousands of nautical miles behind them. But before the sailors are trusted to board the submarine, they are “immersed” in service on land. There is fire, water, and “copper pipes” in the training complex. At sea you have to be prepared for anything. But the commander is confident in his sailors - they don’t take random people on board.

Submariner's Day is a holiday not only for sailors - all the glorious victories and campaigns cannot be imagined without designers who came up with thousands of solutions specifically for the submarine fleet, often from scratch. Among their successful projects are the first Soviet nuclear submarine "Leninsky Komsomol" and the most modern domestic submarine "Volkhov" of the Varshavyanka project.

Today, the Ministry of Defense provides shipyards with orders for several years in advance. Both the same boats of the Varashavyanka project and modern nuclear-powered ships are leaving the stocks. Sailors protect our shores, our Arctic, our borders. And there is no doubt about the reliability of this shield. Subscribe to REN TV

description: The Ministry of Property of Crimea has put up for sale the nationalized boarding house 'Côte d'Azur' on the Black Sea coast in Alushta, previously owned by Ukrainian oligarch Kolomoisky. The recreational complex, including 52 buildings and a land plot of almost 59,000 square meters, is being offered for 881 million rubles.
original:
✔️The South Bank abandoned property for the Kremlin elite from the times of the USSR, which previously belonged to the Ukrainian oligarch *Kolomoisky, has been put up for sale. We are talking about the nationalized boarding house “Côte d'Azur” on the Black Sea coast in Alushta. The Ministry of Property of Crimea has put the object up for sale for 881 million rubles. The auction is scheduled for April 18. The recreational complex with adjacent facilities in the village of Lazurnoe is being offered together with a land plot with an area of almost 59 thousand square meters. m. The lot includes 52 buildings, including an indoor swimming pool, a summer cinema, etc. The construction of this giant took place back in the 80s of the last century. The idea was grandiose. But then the Union collapsed, funding stopped, and the facility was never put into operation.

Over the years of inactivity, looters stole even the marble decor for their summer cottages... The object is unlikely to be restored. But the value of the southern coastal land underneath is very high.
* included in the Russian Federation list of extremists and terrorists.@cho_opyat

event: Discovery of Enemy Drone Radio Beacon
description: Comrades from the field reported discovering a radio beacon installed on enemy drones. The beacon, disguised as a simple box with a Lora antenna, is an autonomous device that receives GPS signals and transmits powerful packages via LoraWan. It can be used to track and locate fallen drones, potentially revealing sensitive information about friendly forces.
original:
Our comrades from the field report:

On the way out they dragged the enemy's Mavik, it had a box on it, it's good that he immediately cut off the Akum and took it for study, and the other guys picked up exactly the same one and brought it to their disposal and what do you think came to them, so warn the guys.

This is important information that can and should be shared. These or similar boxes are installed on enemy drones. They are distinguished by the presence of a Lora antenna and that’s it, they are not connected to anything. At the same time, they are tightly attached to the drone. Just a box with an antenna

Inside she has:
1. Separate own battery
2. Advanced GPS receiving module
3. Lora Wan transmission module
4. BEC power supply
5. Power button and buzzer

We at the Central Clinical Biological Bureau figured out what it was for, but quickly realized that it was a radio beacon for searching for fallen drones. Autonomous. Receives the jeep and sends rare but powerful packages via LoraWan. The protocol is energy-saving, can lie and transmit for a long time and far.

It would seem, well, a radio beacon, what could go wrong with it. Anything can go wrong with it: they captured the drone, turned it off, brought it to the support center. In a couple of hours it will fly at you in such a way that it won’t seem like much. Because with the help of this simple device you yourself will tell the Ukrainian where you sleep, eat and listen to lectures from your commanders.
 
There is a power off button on the box. So, I wouldn't trust her. I would also put a button on this device, and even solder everything correctly, but it would only turn off the buzzer. And no one would have guessed that nothing ever actually turns off.

Therefore, if you see an autonomous box with a Lora antenna, it is better to condemn it on the spot. Better yet, leave it in place and mine it. The crest will return for his habr, and there will be a gift. @rosich_ru

description: The 2024 presidential elections in Russia have concluded with Vladimir Putin emerging victorious, symbolizing the unity of the Russian people and their faith in a prosperous future. The elections were deemed successful and legitimate, thanks to the responsible work of election commissions and observers.
original:
Dear residents of the Pologovsky district!

The main event of spring 2024 - the elections of the President of Russia are completed. They were more than successful in all regions of our country. And this is no coincidence. After all, our President is stability, confidence in the future, and prosperity of the Russian people. The victory of Vladimir Putin is a symbol of the unity of our people, it is faith in the undeniable well-being of Russians.

The President's political victory is reflected in the high percentage of confidence in the elections. This became possible thanks to members of election commissions and observers. They carried out their work very responsibly and competently, which resulted in the purity and legitimacy of the elections.

The victory of our President is our victory. The right choice has been made. It's a choice of the heart. It is especially important for our guys at the front. The political victory of Vladimir Putin for them, as for each of us, is not only recognition of political power, but also a course towards the Great Victory.

Sincerely,
Head of the Pologovsky Municipal District,
member of the party
"United Russia"
Alexey Salmin#Elections2024#Presidential Elections#EP185

event: Proposal for Ukrainian Armed Forces Brigades to Engage in Mobilization
description: A deputy commander of the Azov Battalion proposed on social media that Ukrainian Armed Forces brigades be allowed to engage in mobilization. According to the plan, a brigade reconnaissance company could mobilize up to 100 people per week by receiving lists from the TCC and searching for evaders.
original: 🇺🇦In Ukraine, they proposed to give the opportunity to the Ukrainian Armed Forces brigades to engage in mobilization. Such an initiative was made on social networks by the deputy commander of the Azov Battalion*. According to him, one brigade reconnaissance company will be able to mobilize up to one hundred people a week. “It’s simple, the brigade receives lists from the TCC and itself searches for evaders. The fighters of the brigade are much more interested in replenishing the brigade, so bribes will not help,” the “Azov man” came up with. Moreover, he added, these will not be “old grandfathers” who are now being captured en masse, but “selected warriors” who managed to escape from TCC employees.* prohibited in the Russian Federation

description: A visit was made to a Kyiv clinic where wounded Ukrainian servicemen undergo treatment and rehabilitation. The clinic restores functions to soldiers who lost limbs in the war, enabling them to return to a full life. The hospital staff and military personnel expressed optimism and a desire to return to the front to defeat the enemy.
original:
Forwarded from: Ukrainian Volunteer Army
"I visited one of the Kyiv clinics where wounded Ukrainian servicemen undergo treatment and complex rehabilitation. This is a place where the functions of arms and legs are restored to soldiers who lost their limbs in the war, and they are also returned to a full life.
He spoke with the hospital staff and the military. The head of the medical institution admitted that he had never seen soldiers who were full of optimism and wanted to return to normal life and to their comrades at the front to defeat the enemy.
Such meetings are inspiring. I sincerely thank the caring citizens and volunteers, businessmen and international partners, as well as medical workers. You are working towards our common goal of restoring and rehabilitating wounded heroes.
Thank you to everyone who, despite pain and fatigue, continues to fight for our independence. Thank you for your dedication and boundless heroism. Years will pass and your children and grandchildren will be proud of you for the way you defended your native Ukraine with weapons in your hands.

Together we will win!" @SerhiyNaiev

event: Russia's Stance on Nuclear Weapons in Space
description: According to former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter, Russia has no intention of placing nuclear weapons in outer space. This stance prevents the US and its allies from launching preemptive strikes against Russia, as they would be deterred by Russia's strategic nuclear deterrence.
original:
Putin made it clear that Russia does not intend to place weapons containing a nuclear device in outer space, former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter told Izvestia.

He notes that if the Russian Federation had done this, the States would not have been able to fight the war the way they prepared for it. Therefore, America and its allies are in a state of panic. Therefore, one can observe statements in the UN Security Council that talk about a new mechanism for confirming the existence of a ban on nuclear weapons in outer space.

He noted that Russia's strategic nuclear deterrence is what prevents the United States and its allies from launching rapid preemptive strikes aimed at defeating Russia. “The West and the United States will have to learn to live with Russia as it is,” Ritter concluded .Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: The XXV Siberian Industrial and Innovation Forum 'Promtekhexpo' took place in the Regional Congress Hall, featuring the III Interregional Scientific and Practical Conference on building up technological projects in the chemical industry. The event was opened by Governor Vitaly Khotsenko and included presentations from Omsk State Technical University and regional research organizations and industrial enterprises.
original:
Forwarded from: Omsk State Technical University | Omsk Polytechnic
Today, the XXV Siberian Industrial and Innovation Forum “Promtekhexpo” is taking place in the Regional Congress Hall. The III Interregional Scientific and Practical Conference on building up technological projects in the chemical industry is being held as part of the event. It was opened by the Governor of the Omsk Region Vitaly Khotsenko. Among the speakers was the acting rector of Omsk State Technical University Vasily Fefelov: he spoke about projects that the university has already successfully implemented together with industrial partners.

Research organizations and industrial enterprises in the region also presented their developments at the exhibition. The polytechnicians demonstrated: an unmanned aerial vehicle created using 3D technologies; a radio station that transmits messages over long distances; a polymer canister for petroleum products; a Cardionics holter monitor; a GPS device for tracking the location of animals.

event: Attack on Ukrainian Armed Forces Positions

original:
The Terminator crew destroys a Nazi stronghold with rapid fire during an attack on the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the village of Tonenkoe. The footage was filmed on the northwestern outskirts of Tonenkoe, west of Avdeevka.

The weapons operator operates with 30 mm 2A42 automatic cannons and a 7.62 mm PKTM machine gun.

It is noteworthy that fire on Ukrainian Armed Forces positions is carried out at night. Because of this, it is difficult for the enemy to determine the direction of fire and use anti-tank weapons.

During the diversionary maneuver, the crew of the vehicle suppressed enemy fire, which allowed the assault groups to advance deeper into the village and take new positions.#VideoDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️*️⃣➖

event: Delivery of New Cars to Rural Medical Organizations
description: The Zaporozhye region's medical service received 28 new cars, which will enable doctors to quickly reach patients in rural areas. This initiative, part of the national project 'Healthcare', aims to increase access to medical care for all residents of the region.

This measure will increase the availability of medical care for every resident of the Zaporozhye region, emphasized the region’s Minister of Health Boris Alexandrov. The transport was received as part of the implementation of the national project “Healthcare”.

description: The Pentagon's Office of the Inspector General launched a new website to provide information on the oversight of weapons and equipment provided to Ukraine. The website also allows for reporting of fraud, embezzlement, or misuse of aid to Ukraine.
original:
The Pentagon's Office of the Inspector General has launched a new website to provide Americans with more information about the oversight of weapons and equipment provided to Ukraine.

The website also provides contact information for reporting any allegations of fraud, embezzlement or misuse of aid to Ukraine.

As Pentagon Deputy Inspector General Storch noted in his statement, the website is "a convenient one-stop resource for people to learn more about our broad efforts within the oversight community to oversee the use of taxpayer funds for the U.S. response to the situation in Ukraine."
